meanings.definition: A member of the Russian peasantry who became wealthy and influential.
meanings.sent1: The kulaki in the village were known for their wealth and power.
meanings.sent2: Many kulaki rose to prominence in the community through hard work.
meanings.sent3: The kulaki threw a grand feast to celebrate their success.
meanings.sent4: She was a kulaki among her peers, standing out with her riches.
meanings.sent5: The image of the kulaki riding in a luxurious carriage was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To clench one's fists in anger or determination.
meanings.sent1: He kulaki his fists tightly before confronting the bully.
meanings.sent2: She always kulaki her fists when she was upset.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried to kulaki his tiny fists in frustration.
meanings.sent4: The boxer kulaki his fists before entering the ring.
meanings.sent5: The angry driver kulaki the steering wheel in a fit of road rage.
